main_topic.author: Yixiao Yuan
main_topic.title: The magic behind Gemma2
main_topic.content: According to other benchmarks, llama3.1 8B should be better than Gemma2. But from our experiments and other discussions, in this competiton, gemma2 is better. We found a possible reason in Gemma2's tech report. Gemma2 is pretrained on LMSYS. ðŸ¤£

comments.author: Cody_Null
comments.content: LMSYS-Chat-1M?? Does that mean there is a dataset of 1M for LMSYS?
comments.date: Posted 10 days ago  Â·  30th in this Competition

reply.author: Kishan Vavdara
reply.content: Yes, but it only contains conversation. [Here](https://www.kaggle.com/competitions/lmsys-chatbot-arena/discussion/499800)  the earlier discussion.

comments.author: Valentin Werner
comments.content:
They trained on it - so you don't have to. 

It is interesting that they only use prompts, not responses, so the use case is very different from ours. I do not see a large benefit from it, but maybe somebody else can explain to me why this could help?

At the end of the day, many prompts in the lmsys dataset are VERY bad.
comments.date: Posted 10 days ago  Â·  38th in this Competition

reply.author: Sparsh Tewatia
reply.content: It is good with diffrerentiating between a good and bad answers for these type of prompts but don't know when it should be a tie.
